BERD: Which consortium do you report the solutions for?
Which solutions and plans does your consortium have regarding research software marketplaces?
What are your roles in the consortium?

column3: We have or are currently building our own software marketplace
We have or are currently linking our software metadata to an existing software marketplace.
We have some plans to structure our software / metadata but nothing concrete yet.
We have no plans but would like to stay informed.
We do not have any current plans regarding software marketplaces and are not interested in this topic.

BERD: How do you intend to ensure the sustainability of the services and software in your consortium?
column3: How do you intend to ensure the sustainability (maintaining usability and further development) of the services and software developed or utilized in your consortium?
None, when the research projects end, the software or service will stop working the next time it breaks.

We stop working on it when the projects end but it's open source. We hope the community (e.g. developers on GitHub) contribute fixes and updates and we at least have someone who regularly checks and merges pull requests.
We actually have active communities maintaining and developing the software.
We ourselves keep contributing even after the projects end.

BERD: How do you disseminate your software to get more users?

column3: Institute, university or project web page

BERD: Which metadata formats do you describe your research software with (if any)?
If you use controlled vocabularies, ontologies or knowledge graphs to describe your research software, please list them below (separated via commas, if multiple).
Where do you publish your software and its source code?

column3: We do not create any research software.
We create research software but do not share the source code with others.
